website_summaries.verdict: Customers seeking a reusable rain poncho with stylish designs should look no further than this trendy product.
pros: Stylish patterns great for city walking
Zippered all down the jacket for supreme breathability and various wearing styles
Waterproof with hood and loose sleeves
cons: Has trouble fitting inside included storage bag

customer_reviews.title: Great poncho!
customer_reviews.text: This rain poncho is great! Well made, generously sized, and the material is sturdy AND doesn't crinkle loudly like other rain ponchos I have tried! My only suggestion is to make it a little longer, I am 5'11" and it comes just to my knees. A tad longer would make this poncho perfect! A++
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this rain poncho!
customer_reviews.text: I love this rain poncho! It is light weight and would fit tiny to plus-sized. With a sweater underneath, it works even on cooler days. It’s both attractive and functional. Packable in its own pouch that can act as a small purse or carry-all. Pouch has a carabiner that I like to attach to the zippered pocket. Around the “cuffs” are elastic pulls you can cinch up to keep the rain and wind out. Such wonderful attention to detail! This is the best rain poncho I’ve ever had. Also very flattering on. May order another!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest material, kind of cheap
customer_reviews.text: Not the greatest material, kind of cheap. I do love the colors . The pouch zipper broke the first time I tried zipping it back up. It doesn’t keep you dry for very long, the water eventually soaks in. I Purchased this for rainy days when I have to do a five block walk from the train to my home . I got home wet I wouldn’t spend money on this
customer_reviews.author: tatiana rea

customer_reviews.title: It's very wide at the bottom and blows up in wind
customer_reviews.text: This poncho is circle-shaped, as opposed to my previous rectangle-shaped ponchos. As a result, it's very wide at the bottom and shorter on me than the rectangle-shaped ponchos, and blows up in wind. For me this is not useful. I like the fabric, but it's too short and catches the wind too easily to be good protection from rain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, but.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a bigger person and even on me it's a little big. But on the bright side I can layer in cooler months underneath. The reason I only gave it three stars as I'm somewhat dubious it will hold up to wear and tear as the material does not feel sturdy. Also I'm of a shorter stature and the sleeves do not reach my wrists. For the price though it's cute and I like that it zips. I had purchased a more expensive of the head poncho, but it's annoying to pull over your hair etc.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality and size
customer_reviews.text: At first look, very pleased with the feel and the look of the fabric, silky nylon with a nice drape. I picked this one, although I thought was a bit expensive, because of the full-length sleeves and body. However, the model must be very tiny because the sleeves are just barely hits my wrists and the poncho is shorter, hitting a bit above my knees. Happy to have protection against the rain that packs so small and takes up only a little space.
customer_reviews.author: djaybx

customer_reviews.title: this was unexpectedly large and comfortable. The colors are vibrant and fun - and ...
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting a solid poncho after reading the reviews, especially after someone commented they expected this to be much smaller and shorter. I am 5'10" and usually can't find free size clothing that is long enough - however, this was unexpectedly large and comfortable. The colors are vibrant and fun - and I wear this as a teacher on playground duty; its fun and modern looking.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Novalis

customer_reviews.title: Loved the fit, hated the SMELL!!!
customer_reviews.text: I loved the fit of this poncho. Exactly what I was looking for, and long enough so my jeans wouldn't get soaked walking the dogs in the rain. But the SMELL, it was awful. Like anal glands on a dog awful. I even let it air dry for a week after using on a stormy day and still the smell is bad. I ordered the dandelion pattern, so not sure if it was related to that. I'm returning, but am going to try a different pattern to see if that helps. Will update my review on the new pattern, so fingers crossed I get a keeper next time around.
customer_reviews.author: c*orion

customer_reviews.title: Best rain cape ever
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear a 3X because I like room to move. This fits me with room to spare. I love that it totally keeps out the wind and the rain so walking my 3 dogs at the same time in lousy weather is not an issue. The hood is deep with a bit of a bill in the front which helps protect my glasses. I love this rain cape! I can layer up underneath if I want to. It is not "water resistant", it is waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: GSalTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not quite as it seems..
customer_reviews.text: It's SOOOO not worth the money. Not only is it too small, it's also paper thin and came to me riddled with wrinkles. I immediately put it in my donation box. Unfortunate because the design is so cute.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Festival & Cosplay

customer_reviews.title: Great for travelers and bus riders
customer_reviews.text: I ride the bus to work and need good rain cover when the downpours start. I need my raingear to roll up tight so i can snug it into my work backpack, ready in a rainatorm. I also want it to be able to drape over my packpack while i wear it, so that we both stay dry. I want to stand out, color wise, so that drivers have less excuse to run me down. And i don't want it too heavy because Florida is humid and often hot. This poncho meets all of my requirements. I love it!!
customer_reviews.author: DogMom

customer_reviews.title: cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: arrived quickly, great fit. cheap construction however. when i tried to unbutton two of the sleeve buttons, one ripped completely off and the other caused a rip in the jacket, I can still wear it but that happened on the first use and was extremely disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: MaryNana

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this poncho to put on when bringing food and water to our backyard flock on rainy days. I’ve been using it for short times outside for many months and it has been fine. Today I had to tie down a tarp that had come loose on their run, so I was in the rain (steady rain, not a downpour) for about 15-20 minutes. When I came in, I was disappointed to discover that my shirt was drenched from the shoulders all the way down both sleeves. Luckily I was at home and could change my shirt. If I had been at work it would have made for an uncomfortable day. Water-resistant, not waterproof!
customer_reviews.author: momof2

customer_reviews.title: she loved it! It was cute and it kept her ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter who uses a wheelchair. She usually hates ponchos but we were going to an outdoor concert together and rain was forecast. She groaned when I told her I bought a poncho for her, But when she saw it, she loved it! It was cute and it kept her nice and dry. She made sure to keep it with her in a backpack. She lives on her own and goes to college and spends time commuting. It will be of great use. The material was perfect, not too thin and not too heavy.
customer_reviews.author: meroz

customer_reviews.title: Too big 😳
customer_reviews.text: WAY WAY too big, even for a one size fits all. The material was just okay, I sent it back same day I received it.
customer_reviews.author: Debbey in AZ

customer_reviews.title: Great length and coverage
customer_reviews.text: This rain poncho provided ample coverage. I liked that the length is longer than waist length. What did bother me was the fishy smell when I first opened it. The smell lasted for a couple days even after leaving it hanging to air out. I decided to wash it on delicate cycle with liquid detergent. The smell was still there but only slightly. After, hanging it up for about a week the smell is gone. Otherwise, I would say this is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Dora

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Kept me dry in the Guatamalan and Belize rain forest. Its a high quality product with nice sturdy zippers and hood pulls. My only concern is that the vinyl sticks together once collapsed in the bag. If you have to quickly put it on you'll see it takes a little time to unstick the vinyl layers to fully unfurl it. Plenty of room will cover a larger size person easily.
customer_reviews.author: Ms, MB

customer_reviews.title: Its a Rain poncho
customer_reviews.text: It did what it is supposed to do.. protect from the rain. I like this poncho because I have one already that is better quality but I dislike the fact that it is a pull over...that is why I bought this one, it has a long zipper but it just flew all over the place when I was out in the wind...other than that I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: Great Choice
customer_reviews.text: This is about as stylish as a rain poncho can get. It's lightweight and breathes, so the inside doesn't feel like a sauna! It folds up nicely into its pouch, although I have to get down on the floor to fold it - you can't just stuff it in there. The front zipper is brilliant - no dragging over your head required. It can be challenging to get it started zipping in a high wind, but that's no big deal. The only thing I didn't like is the caribiner. Great idea, so I replaced the cheap one that came with it (and broke on the first use) with one I already had.
customer_reviews.author: GMissyZ

customer_reviews.title: Works to keep the rain off
customer_reviews.text: I say just right on the fit because it covers and has some to spare. I did not like the lining, or is more of a plastic. I do like the outer fabric. It is not silent when you move
customer_reviews.author: Linda Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Kept Dry During Four Straight Days of Rain
customer_reviews.text: This poncho saved me! We were out in the pouring rain before dawn and late into the afternoon, and I stayed warm and dry. I did have warm layers of clothing and my jacket underneath, though. It is very lightweight and super roomy and well made. It can fit small to very large folks. I am 5'2" and it came down to my lower calves. The sleeves have a little loop to put around one of your fingers that helps keep the sleeves down, which were long and kept my jacket sleeves dry. great price and great quality!
customer_reviews.author: E. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Heading to Vietnam soon and it’s the rainy season. We decided our Dollar store cheap-o ponchos wouldn’t be worth the $1 we paid so after reading reviews I ordered 2 of these. Love them, they’re super roomy, great color, deep blue, the fabric is lightweight and feels like umbrella material and folds up into a pouch with a carabiner hook to attach to our backpacks. I think they’ll be perfect. There’s a nice sized hood, a pocket and zips all the way up. Big plus it looks well made. So glad I bit the bullet and made the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Poncho
customer_reviews.text: I just received this poncho yesterday and used it for the first time today--cold, windy and rainy. I love this poncho. I ordered medium. I am 5'10", 163 lbs. It fit to a T. The sides come down to my wrists and the front comes to the top of my knees. The fabric is soft and appears well constructed. Rhis will work perfectly when carrying my camera. I may buy another one in a different color, I got black and really like it. I would recommend this product. It folds neatly into a pouch and can be carried easily in a suitcase.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Kennard

customer_reviews.title: Very roomy and the white Polk dots are very cute.
customer_reviews.text: I’m 5’3 and the back reached my calves. Really roomy so I can fit shopping bags under them. Sleeves are formed by snaps on sides. And full zipper on the front. The hood has elastic bungee cord allowing you to tighten around your head. Wish there was a bit more of a brim. It’s thin nylon, so very packable and lightweight but not flimsy like the plastic sheets you get on cheaper ponchos. It hasn’t been tested yet, I’m sure it will hold off most rains, but hoping it will protect against torrential downpours which is why I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: ABC MOM

customer_reviews.title: Kept me dry from the knees up
customer_reviews.text: Was able to use several days this week in the pouring rain. I wore this over my winter coat with a backpack on my back and was completely covered down to my knees. There are arm holes but it was nice to be able to keep them inside. The hood was generous as it came down over my face. There is a zip pocket at well. It is lightweight and flows, not stiff plastic like others. Comes with a pouch to store in which is great for my backpack.
customer_reviews.author: PoconoMom3

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and fits into  a pouch so It is always with me on rainy days!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product because it is large. I am a very heavy woman and it is perfect for me. It is well made, well designed and it folds into a pouch so that I can carry it with me on rainy days. Hood is way to big for me, but I don't need that as I always use an umbrella. For the money, it is really great....but it is VERY large.
customer_reviews.author: Give Peas a chance!

customer_reviews.title: Just right to protect from Costa Rican Rain Showers
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this poncho to protect myself during inevitable rain showers during an upcoming trip to Costa Rica. The length is good and the material is a nylon taffeta type fabric, so not like a hot, sticky plastic poncho, which will be helpful for breathability in tropical temps and humidity. I also like that the poncho zips up. It has snaps to give the “sleeves” as customized fit so that area doesn’t ride up. This will easily drape over a backpack or cross body bag/purse to protect from rain. I had little trouble folding it small enough to fit right back into the nifty carry pouch.
customer_reviews.author: MickeyDachs

customer_reviews.title: Rainy day poncho
customer_reviews.text: I love this rain poncho, the zipper in front is so convenient. Snaps on side. It came so quick, just in time for me to wear on a rainy day. I would definitely recommend it. So much better those cheap ones. It is also warm, I didn’t need a jacket.
customer_reviews.author: GGMcMurray

customer_reviews.title: Really bad quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a very low quality product. Flimsy!!!! The photo makes it look like it has some body and weight to the material but it is of the thinest thinest plastic. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Va

customer_reviews.title: Great wind and rain protection
customer_reviews.text: Hit mid-calf (I’m 5’2”). Very loose poncho - plenty of room for even a winter coat underneath. The outside zipped pocket was convenient for my phone. The zipper worked great. (I returned the navy one because the zipper wasn’t as substantial. It would catch in the flap. Also the tan one fit back in the envelope case easier.) Easy to throw on during a downpour. It blocked all the wind and rain on a stormy day on the coast. The hood toggles to your adjustment and stays on. I used the clip On the outside of my purse because of lack of space while traveling! Very handy and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Margo T.

customer_reviews.title: A good poncho. Very cute pattern and color
customer_reviews.text: A good poncho. Very cute pattern and color. I'm about 5'5 and it comes down to around my knees. I can wear this over my backpack and it'll keep both my backpack and the back of my legs pretty dry. I like the pocket! The "sleeves" aren't long enough to keep my forearms dry, though, especially when I'm biking through the rain. But it keeps most every other part of me dry, so it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: Indah

customer_reviews.title: Well Made!!
customer_reviews.text: Looks just like as advertised I have'nt used it yet I did'nt purchase just for rain I will use to cover my clothes as added protection when I am on the metro, i.e. bus,train system Which is how I commute to&from work.I just want to provide myself a little more protection.It seems well made so I will carry also on rainey days it comes with its own matching zipper pouch as well.So far I like it.
customer_reviews.author: luvieT

customer_reviews.title: 4.90 stars really
customer_reviews.text: One size never fits all when you are only 5’ tall, but in this case, big is ok, because it will cover more of me when it rains. For you larger folk - you will have *plenty* of room. In Florida, it rains more in warm weather, so the light, breathable fabric is great. Other pluses - large hood with draw string & large zippered pocket. - .10 of a star because it comes in a really nice little bag, but the zipper didn’t work, so I had to cut it open. That little bag would have been very useful for keeping the poncho safely in my car or luggage.
customer_reviews.author: Chaya

customer_reviews.title: It's Not Flattering, But Works Well!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, it's not the most flattering rain attire lol, however, it does it's job, keeping me dry whilst I take my dog out to potty! It's definitely big... it pretty much covers my entire body, granted, I am only 5'4, so if you are taller it won't be as big. It reminds me of a wearable tarp! The pattern is cute, it's easy to get on, and it comes with a little case to stuff it into when you need to throw it in a bag, or store it away. No, you are not going to win a fashion show, but if you need something to throw on while running to the car, or taking out your pooch, it's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: AmyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: A lot of material
customer_reviews.text: I love the color. I know it will keep me dry as I wore it once during a really heavy downpour. My problem is that it was a lot of material to be moving around, getting into and out of my car. This poncho would better suit on days when I'm just going to be out in the rain for long periods of time. And, it doesn't have a drawstring to keep the hood on and placed just so during windy days. Plus, I would have liked an inside pocket or two. I may use this poncho again, but I went ahead and ordered an actual rain coat. I'll probably use it more often.
customer_reviews.author: Kandisimo

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful all purpose rain poncho
customer_reviews.text: I started making grocery deliveries this year and it's been rainy where I live. I wanted to get a rain poncho for particularly rainy days and this poncho fit my needs perfectly. What I like is that any adult size (or almost any) can wear it - even if you are plus size, it has snaps to loosen (or tighten) the arm if needed and is wide enough across that I could fit at least two of me in it (and I am plus size). It's made of material that seems like an umbrella and keeps most of me dry when I wear it on rainy days. I'd highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Author & Book Lover

customer_reviews.title: Better than an umbrella
customer_reviews.text: BUY THIS! It is super cute, has options to snap on the sides so you have sleeves or leave them open for a poncho look, folds up super easy and the pouch to put it in is actually large enough to fit it even if you don’t fold it nice and fancy. I used this in NYC on a cold rainy night and it was so convenient! The polka dots made it whimsical and I received many compliments. It’s a rain poncho people - hard to make it a cute look - but THIS is the one!
customer_reviews.author: jaimers123

customer_reviews.title: Light weight & long!
customer_reviews.text: This poncho is perfect I leave this at work, just in case it rains and it’s perfect! I bought an extra large I wanted it to be loose, I could have gone with a large and it would have still been loose....it’s long enough where my pants aren’t getting soaked....because I got the extra large and I’m 5”4 it comes down to my knees which is perfect for me!
customer_reviews.author: EnvyLiz

customer_reviews.title: Fits even the biggest person!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this today so haven't tested the waterproof-ness (got it for a trip to Ireland) but as far as fit, that was my biggest concern, as I'm a big gal. Even on me, with a M cup chest and approx 380 lbs (don't worry y'all I'm getting gastric bypass later this year) it is big on me! So if it can for me, I have no doubt it can fit anyone!! And is roomy enough to cover your purse/backpack etc. I got the star print which I just now realized is going to scream "American!" Lol but it looks cute and I'm just so happy it's big so I don't have to worry.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: really lovely
customer_reviews.text: Item appears exactly as described in the picture, and arrived in a timely fashion. I'm giving it four stars though, because there is only one pocket in the poncho, so if you want to put anything in it that has any sort of weight in that pocket, you're gonna get that 'lopsided' feeling, and no opposing pocket for counter-balance. Also, there is no way in HAIL this poncho is going to get back into the cute little teensy matching bag. I'd rather they skip the bag and put in the second pocket, or make the bag bigger, and forgo the pocket altogether.
customer_reviews.author: spinstapink

customer_reviews.title: Really nice rain poncho
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice poncho. I love polka dots, and this will lift spirits when it's raining. It is well made, has a zippered pocket as well as a front zipper. It fits in a zippered rectangular pouch, and can be worn on a belt, or hung by the carabiner. I sew, and this is well made, no sloppiness. There is a bit of elastic at the sleeve ends so you can put your finger through it to keep the poncho extended. At least that's what I'll use those bits for. I am very pleased with this poncho.
customer_reviews.author: Rosiel

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for travel!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS. First of all, it will fit most sizes! I’m a plus sized woman and usually wear a 1X/2X top and 2X bottom, and this is neither tight, snug, nor restrictive. This is great for travel as you’ll be able to wear any outfit underneath without worrying you won’t be able to zipper your rain coat, and it’s easy to pack as it condenses into a small pouch! It’s not going to be your trendiest rain coat, BUT if you’re looking for something easy, comfortable and great for camping, hiking, trips to the beach in the rainier/cooler months, travel, etc., look no further!
customer_reviews.author: Char

customer_reviews.title: Fit big people.
customer_reviews.text: Great poncho. Bought one for me and my wife. I'm a big guy. 6'1" and 320 lbs, 56" chest and it fits great. We keep them on our boat for fishing. We just used them today. Kept us dry, didn't make us sweat underneath them and they fold up easily to fit in the little pouch that comes with them. The full zipper on the front makes them easy to put on and take off. I Highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Chris R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect...Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to wear at the NFL Draft in Nashville. I wanted something stylish and functional. This was both. And I needed it. As soon as Roger Goodell starting talking it started to rain :(. The poncho came in a little pouch which I was able to use after I pulled the poncho out of it. No pickets but it had a hood. Would highly recommend. I am 5 feet tall and weight 120 lbs most days :).
customer_reviews.author: Nash Lady

customer_reviews.title: Great design but not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: One hour walk in a gentle steady rain with a t shirt and fleece jacket on RESULTS = the fleece was fairly saturated in the neck, arms and back. I was wearing a brimmed Marmot Precip cap under the hood and I didn't check the wetness but it was probably wet as well. BOTTOM LINE: The poncho sports a really nice design, is available in a lot of colors and designs and has a soft fabric feel but it does NOT keep water out. Water seeps through. I would say this poncho is water RESISTANT only. For me, at 5'9" the the poncho goes down just below the knee in front and little lower in back.
customer_reviews.author: rpsteledata

customer_reviews.title: Tough and thick poncho with great features!
customer_reviews.text: This poncho has so many great features and it is completely waterproof. Stylish, zipper pocket for phone, finger loops to keep you ponch sleeves down. Great length, I'm 5"2 and it kept my legs dry. This is a very sterdy poncho. I wore it on 16 rollercoasters in the rain, and not a rip or tear. I got one for my mom too. She loves it. My only suggestion is that you need a hat to keep the hood from falling over your eyes
customer_reviews.author: Erin Wyer

customer_reviews.title: I’d purchase again
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a trip to Disney. We did encounter a very heavy downpour and I’m glad I had this. The length was ok, it could have been a little longer but I’m 5’7” and it hit about mid thigh. It kept me pretty dry but eventually started to saturate though a little. The zip closure was nice to have. As expected, it was difficult to get it back into the small little pouch that it came in. It was nice and compact in my backpack until I had used it once, then the pouch became bulky and took up more space as I had to stuff it back in.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Dykstra

customer_reviews.title: Like wearing a stiff shower curtain
customer_reviews.text: This is HUGE...the description says "one size fit US S to XL; It is big enough to wear with a backpack"...I would say this would fit a 3X woman with a backpack no problem! Also, YES, you can fold this up into its little pouch, but NO, it's not the kind of "Light Texture...Breathable...Polyester" I was expecting...much more like a stiff shower curtain than soft, flexible, nylon-like that I'd hoped. Oh, well.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Pam

customer_reviews.title: Very pretty color and style. But, hood impedes vision, a finger loops couldn't be used!
customer_reviews.text: I liked the zip closure, the snaps under arm hole openings and down the sides. Red with white dots, very pretty. Received several compliments on it. I didn't like the hood covering my eyes, even when cinched around face with drawstring. Would have preferred a hood with bill attached to keep rain out of face, but not restricting my vision. Elastic loops at your hand areas were a wasted feature, as looping them over your fingers, made the poncho pull away from the body and be uncomfortable. So, I couldn't use them.
customer_reviews.author: Just Me D

customer_reviews.title: Love this fun yellow rain poncho!
customer_reviews.text: I gravitate to black when buying clothes, but I knew if I bought a rain poncho in black it would look like a big black trash bag with arm holes cut out, lol. I won't lie, I have done that before in a pinch. So, to avoid another fashion failure like that again, I bought the bright yellow poncho and I love it! I'm hoping for a rain day soon! I am also pleased with the quality of the plastic. It's not thick, but it's not too thin either. It's strong, but is also flexible - so it's perfect for summer rains here in blazing hot Texas.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi Z

customer_reviews.title: IF YOU'RE AT LEAST A 3X
customer_reviews.text: The ONLY reason I'm not giving this a 5 star is because it is enormous! I am a 1X and unless you are at least a 3X don't order it. The color is wonderful as is the quality for the money. It has a nice carrying case and would make a thoughtful gift. I'm very disappointed. A one size fits all is always a close call for me, so I ordered this by taking a chance feeling it might be okay. If you're a small, medium or even large/X-large, don't do it.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely humongous on me & I wear 2x or 3x clothing
customer_reviews.text: This was so unbelievably huge I had to return it. I wear 2x.or 3x clothes & this poncho was ginormous on me...I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Peraza

customer_reviews.title: Rather big for a woman.
customer_reviews.text: I love the pattern and the weight of this raincoat poncho. Since it is a one size fits all, it is rather big for a short woman. The jacket length comes below the knee on me. I plan to keep this in the car for times I get caught out in the rain and forgot my regular raincoat. It does fold up nicely into a small pouch.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: It's just as pictured, very nice. I'm 5.38 feet tall and it reaches below my knees at the front, at the back it's a little bit longer. Very nice fabric (it's not plastic), I haven't worn it yet, just tried it on, it's lightweight and very loose so it can go over even coats. It has an elastic loop, theorically to hook the end of what would be the sleeve to your middle finger, but the fabric is not so long, it reaches my wrists, so the loop is unusable. I think that it's not necessary anyway, since the first clasp closes both sides quite near to the wrist, I think that'll avoid the fabric to move up the arm.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia

customer_reviews.title: Just another garbage bag
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a black poncho. After reading so many wonderful reviews, I finally purchased it for the purpose of going rob louder Than Life all wknd. We just got the pinch today and took it out to try on. It fits just fine but this poncho is nothing more than an expensive garbage bag with snaps and a zipper and instantly started sweating in it for the 5 minutes that it was on while inside in the A/C. I really had high hopes because I wanted to get more to take to Disney. I had better luck buying a rain coat at the Goodwill. Guess I’ll be searching for another one.
customer_reviews.author: Gretch

customer_reviews.title: Great rain poncho
customer_reviews.text: Love this purchase,walked in rain in it and it did its job well. Pretty color/pattern. If i was to suggest / add anything to improve it, it would be length of it at the hands/wrist area,it falls about 3 inches short so only my wrist area got wet. Other then that it is great,zipper works well and so do snaps for under arms area.
customer_reviews.author: Spa3

customer_reviews.title: Really Adorable Raincoat!
customer_reviews.text: Really adorable raincoat! Purchased the navy flowered version -- for travel: very waterproof, breathable, knee-length, lightweight, with hood, attractive/cute, packable (comes with pouch)... Ticks all the boxes, and under $25!! I Looking forward to using it! And seeing if it's as waterproof as claimed. (The inside seams are sealed.)
customer_reviews.author: Smile!

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Love my Poncho. I use this for back pack hunting. I like that it's oversized because i'm 5'1 and it covers up to my knees. When it's raining i'm way more protected. I do like that it has a zipper all down the middle, it allows me to easily cover myself and my bag if I needed to. Its an easy on /off too. The arms use buttons to close them closer but they are not like a sweater clinging to your wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: It's very big, it's not attractive, but it does work well
customer_reviews.text: took this on a vacation to France....very light to roll up and pack so that's a big plus....one size fits all, and I'm a slight woman who wears a size 4 so wow this thing, as you would expect, was massive but it kept me dry, totally dry....so if you are looking for function and ease of travel this is for you I took a star off for lack of fashion, would be nice to have a smaller option!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: fabulous rain poncho!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this rain poncho for myself for our family camping trip. It was supposed to rain a lot and I wanted to be prepared. Although it only rained for 1 day out of 7, I was prepared! It worked beautiful and the pattern is super fun! It's made from the same material as an umbrella, so it kept me dry and stylish! I would buy again if I need to! I especially like that it zips up the front as I didn't want to put it over my head to get it on! :)
customer_reviews.author: Eileen B

customer_reviews.title: Great choice: will be buying more as gifts
customer_reviews.text: This did tend to blow up in a high wind but it still kept me a lot drier than an umbrella would have in that wind! The zipper goes nice and high. The buttons for the "sleeves" come undone a little easily but overall, this was a great choice and I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Efird

customer_reviews.title: A great buy!
customer_reviews.text: This rain poncho is an excellent choice for times when you needs your hands free, (as opposed to carrying an umbrella). It's light weight and generous in size. I'm very short, (4'10"), so it comes nearly to my knees. The fabric is not binding. Best of all, it dries very fast. I gave this to my daughter who has a new baby and a toddler. She likes it because she can stay dry and still use her hands to hold on to her kids.
customer_reviews.author: K. Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Totally Sorry It’s Too Big
customer_reviews.text: This is nice material that comes in beautiful patterns. The design elements are perfect! Now I have the bad news! The poncho is so big it would cover an elephant. There is way too much material to deal with especially if it’s raining. You will constantly be clutching the tent that surrounds you. Really wish this nice poncho came in a choice of sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: I like that this has a zipper so easy to open ...
customer_reviews.text: I like that this has a zipper so easy to open to let out heat. This saved me in a recent hike. Not super light weight but worked because my hiking raincoat failed to keep me dry and this I just threw over me and fit over my pack and I could keep going. When I got really hot I unzipped it most way It does not breath but because it is a poncho there is some airflow.... I did sweat but also kept warm (was hiking in cooler weather) . Hope this helps. Love the little pouch carrier too.
customer_reviews.author: Caja

customer_reviews.title: Works well and takes up little space
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our Disney trip and will use it when we go to New Zealand. It adds very little weight to my bag and takes up very little room overall. I wanted something a bit more substantial than disposable and not glaring yellow. It's a poncho and works like a poncho. Kept me and my pack dry and was not too hot. Overall, I like it and would recommend it. If you want fitted and stylish, this is not the product for you and you probably want a rain jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Lehman

customer_reviews.title: Best poncho ever!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this poncho! I'm 5' so it came to almost my knees, but that was okay b/c it kept me dry! The hood came down a little lower on my forehead than I normally like, but I just tightened the straps around it to get it where I wanted it. I love that it has a pocket and a zipper on the front! Most don't. I got the super cute navy w/white polka dots. Wasn't too thin like cheaper ones. The thickness is just right!
customer_reviews.author: Susannah M.

customer_reviews.title: Singing In The Rain....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an upcoming trip and as promised, it fits into a small pouch. I tried it on and like that it is comfortably large and long enough. I live in Florida so a poncho has to be large enough to allow air to circulate and long enough to cover shorts or capris length pants. The snaps work easily and look sturdy. Now all I have to do is wait to see what it's like in the rain! From all appearances it will be perfect. I'm really glad I found this easy solution for travel and afternoon downpours.
customer_reviews.author: DolphinWatcher

customer_reviews.title: Saved my vacation!
customer_reviews.text: As I was planning my trip, I knew I was headed into the rainy season. I was uncertain if an umbrella was be adequate so I ordered the long poncho. It was perfect! Others wore the cheap $2 ponchos that in no time flat were destroyed by the wind and rain. A few dollars saved me from getting drenched and saved me from getting sick. It was also durable without being heavy, came in its own pouch.
customer_reviews.author: claire k

customer_reviews.title: dry and toasty
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a rainy weekend which attended two different all day outdoor activities where down pours happened often, I am 5 ft 7 in and am a plus size lady. It covered my arms and covered down to below my bottom. With my rain boots on I stayed quit dry and got lots of complaints on how it looked. I would beyond a doubt buy this item again. Oh on Sat it was in the high 50's and I wore just a t-shirt and hoodie under it and was nice and toasty. Sunday was 60's but super windy and only had on a t shirt and sweatshirt on and was a little warm.
customer_reviews.author: Peaches

customer_reviews.title: Fits My Plan Perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted. As I’ve aged, I’ve added a few pounds, and I haven’t worn a swimming suit in years. When my children & grandchildren visit during the Christmas season, we very much enjoy going to the hot springs just a few miles away. Thus, I ordered a swimsuit & this as my cover up. I haven’t used it this way yet; however, my plan is to wear it over my swimsuit & possibly even into the pool. At least, one way or another, I’ll be in the water with my family! I’m excited & thankful to have found it! I’ll keep you posted! Merry Christmas to all!
customer_reviews.author: Yolanda S.

customer_reviews.title: This did not protect mefrom the rain!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this poncho for a trip To Costa Rica. I purchased it 8/29/19. The trip started 10/16/19. i was quite excited to have this nice, new poncho. Unfortunately, the first time I used it, I got completely soaking wet to my underwear. There is only a 30 day return period. I am stuck with this useless poncho. I would not recommend anyone to purchase this if you want to be protected from the rain. I cannot even get a refund. Is there lower than a1 star rating?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice poncho
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a vacation in Puerto Rico during the rainy season. I really liked that it zips open in front and you don't have to put it over your head each time. Hood is plenty big and protects your whole head from getting wet. It's not too hard to stuff back in its pouch, so works well for travel. Back home, I use it a lot for my public transit commute - I can fit a large purse or backpack underneath with me so everything stays dry.
customer_reviews.author: L. Crane

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT PONCHO
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness this is a superb poncho with a hood!!!! It’s also beautiful. I bought one for my cousin and myself for an upcoming mission trip to the Philippines and we both love our ponchos. I wear a 3X and have plenty of room in mine and she wears a large and loved how baggy it was on her. We love the zip up storage bag that the ponchos come in!!! Packs very small!! If you need a poncho, this is the one to get. We also love the material. Not super thick or heavy!! Perfect!!
customer_reviews.author: Missionmarcher

customer_reviews.title: Difficult zipper was the deal-breaker for me
customer_reviews.text: Pretty poncho, though a bit too much material for me. Mostly, I found it so difficult to zip up that I've returned it. The zipper runs rough to begin with, plus it kept catching on the fabric it was sewn into so I had to release where it caught multiple times on its way up. This poncho would be great if, in addition to the zipper, it had 2-3 snap closures so that zipping wouldn't be necessary to keep it closed.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Christian

customer_reviews.title: Nice fabric,  but too bulky
customer_reviews.text: Love the material, it feels nice and doesnt make crinkly noise like other rain gear, BUT there is WAY too much fabric! I am keeping because I dont have time to find a different option. I am 5'5" 160#. Cut the fabric down by 1/3 or more and I might buy another. I like the zipper feature.
customer_reviews.author: K. Bowdish

customer_reviews.title: Perfection
customer_reviews.text: I bought this poncho for the KC Chiefs CS Baltimore Ravens game sept 22,2019. It rained for hours before and about 30 mins during. I stayed perfectly dry! It’s so big I was able to spread it over my boyfriends legs too to keep him dry.
customer_reviews.author: Radtechie

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS ITEM!
customer_reviews.text: This would make a great cover for your automobile! It is way too big and would cover an entire family of five! I thought it would be good to take to Scotland as it rains quite a bit, but it arrived at the last minute so I didn't have a chance to check it out. When I did open it, I was flabbergasted as it was huge. My son-in-law said it would make a great cover for his SUV to keep the snow off the windshield and side windows. I missed the opportunity to send it back as I was gone for 5+ weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Tiger

customer_reviews.title: Not for heavy rain!!!
customer_reviews.text: Would fit anyone very big (I'm a size US 24). However, not for downpour rain. The bottom of my dress got soaked cuz it kept sliding up. Also the hood fell over my eyes so I couldn't see and had to hold my hand there and water fell down my sleeve. This would be good for light rain or to use with an umbrella. My walk to work was awful in this poncho...
customer_reviews.author: Ammer1163646

customer_reviews.title: Too short
customer_reviews.text: It does the job. I wish it would be a little longer. It does not long enough to touch a long rain boots. So as soon as it gets wet it’ll stick to the legs, or gets jeans wet. A hood need a visor. Face gets wet easily.
customer_reviews.author: Elena N

customer_reviews.title: Cute and functional!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to wear during my son’s games. I love it. It looks great and will keep me dry. Has a hood that you can cinch and a zipper in the front. There’s also a small pocket in the front for your phone or keys. The material isn’t too thick but not so thin as to tear. There’s plenty of room no matter what size you are. I am 5’7” and wear a XL/1x and it goes past my knees and a lot of room to spare. I will definitely be using this and glad I decided to purchase this.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Stone

customer_reviews.title: Great for all weather seasons.
customer_reviews.text: This is big enough that you could wear something under it when it gets a little colder. We have cold rainy fall weather and this really is a great buy. I'm 5' 2" and it falls almost to my knees. You can also adjust the sides with the snaps to make the openings fit to your liking. Wish it had pockets on both sides.
customer_reviews.author: A. James

customer_reviews.title: Good coverage...
customer_reviews.text: I will be using this on our trip to Ireland and will update once it's been worn. The color is nice and the fit covers to just above the knees and is roomy which will allow you to wear it over a backpack if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and fun print!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this ponchos ahead of a trip to Disney World. I wanted something to keep me dry and be easy to get on and off for rides and not be too hot--as some raincoats are prone to do. It is bigger than I expected, but isn't cumbersome or bulky. It is comfortable and rolled up easily when I needed to take it off. I appreciate the snaps on the sides to create hand holes and the corded hood so it can be snugged around the face--very important for that peripheral vision when in a crowd!
customer_reviews.author: SMKMSHOPS

customer_reviews.title: Just okMa
customer_reviews.text: I used this poncho on a photo trip in Florida. I kept my camera underneath it while not using it and it worked fine. I would have given the poncho five stars but the hood is too small or short. It needs a bill as your forehead is not covered and your head gets soaked. I had hoped to use the poncho in Costa Rica, but I will need to buy another one with better head coverage for that.
customer_reviews.author: Tosca

customer_reviews.title: Awesome poncho!
customer_reviews.text: This poncho is awesome. I am 5’11”, wear a size 16 and it comes to my knees. I love that is has 3 sets of snaps on each side to make “sleeves” which keeps it from shifting around. The zipper is substantial and the size of the poncho fits over a heavy coat. I’m not sure about getting it back into the carrying pouch, but I will definitely get my money’s worth out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Sharilew

customer_reviews.title: Solid Raincoat with a Fashion Statement
customer_reviews.text: it's been pouring in Los Angeles lately, and I felt I needed to upgrade from an umbrella to a rain coat because my legs were getting wet every time it rained. This raincoat is solid – it's made of a matte plastic material, and drapes quite nicely so no water gets in. The sleeves are a little weird – when you raise your arms up, the fabric basically forms the shape of a rectangle around your body. My fiance refuses to be seen in public with me when I wear this rain coat, but at least I can keep my pant legs dry now.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie O

customer_reviews.title: Well made, folds nicely into a small pouch, useful for a wide range of sizes...Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for outdoor events where rain is probable. I love the fit for reference, I am a 5'10" woman and rather slim. It is large and so I can see how it would fit a range of sizes. It probably would be a bit long for someone 5' or under yet that is a personal preference. It is very well made and the fabric is durable AND it can be folded into a nice little neat pouch to throw in a backpack/ purse and or carry on suitcase. I plan to keep it in my car just in case I get caught in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: Water2wine

customer_reviews.title: Cute but already broken after one wear.
customer_reviews.text: This rain jacket is so pretty and worked really well keeping me dry for a day outside in the rain. HOWEVER, the good strap broke within the first two hours of wearing it, and I wasn’t even pulling in the strings! Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie C

customer_reviews.title: A perfect poncho to keep everything you’re wearing dry.
customer_reviews.text: This poncho is very very loose. The hood fit great. It has a zipper pocket with is wonderful. There are a lot of colors to choose from. It’s made out of the same fabric as an umbrella so it should be rainproof. I haven’t tested it but I am buying them for every preschool teacher in my school to keep their own clothes virus free during this pandemic. It should keep them nice and dry while teaching outside this crazy Covid-19 year.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Solid choice for this cyclist
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my bicycle for wet commutes when it's not too cold or warm. I live in Pittsburgh, so we have a lot of wet weather. Works well, though the back will fly up with some speed. I've also used it to drape over my bicycle while I'm inside during work to protect my chain and gearing system in heavier rain days. I may do this over the winter as well, to minimize the weather wear. It packs down pretty small so I can keep it in my pannier with my other maintenance items, just in case. Fabric feels good, and I enjoy the pattern.
customer_reviews.author: Kat G

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, not cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Poncho. I wanted one that didn't look like a plastic disposable one. It is definitely very nice. I am taking it to Europe with me. It will be hot where we are going and I did not want to take a regular coat.. Just wanted it in case of a downpour. This will be perfect
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Nicer than expected for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something to keep packed in the car that was dressy enough for work and Casual enough for jeans if I happen to get caught in a shower. The poncho has nice big pockets, a full zipper on the front so you don't have to pull it on over your head, and reasonably sized holes for your hands to poke out as sleeves. The poncho also fits back into the package that it came in. It packs well and resists wrinkles.
customer_reviews.author: Teena P

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: The snaps all along both sides leave big openings for rain and wind to get through
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: the case it was in lasted one day and the zipper tore away from the material
customer_reviews.author: Syd

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: This poncho is exactly what I wanted. Had a really old one that leaked a couple of weeks ago, because the seam sealer tape had come out. Of course I had to find out the hard way! This arrived yesterday, and it hasn't rained, so will have to try out that aspect later. I specifically searched for a poncho with a front zipper, because my claustrophobia has increased with age. The color is girly and fun, the length is enough to stay dry standing or sitting, its roomy enough to go over any clothes, and the hood can be cinched down so it'll stay in place. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Neal Grillot

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Poncho
customer_reviews.text: For the first time ever I brought something that looks better than the picture. I absolutely love my poncho and I receive so many compliments...it’s a sturdy waterproof material in a deep blue and it has a zip in front and pockets on the side along with a hood...I purchase two of this product one is in my truck and the other in my closet, I am always prepared.
customer_reviews.author: Exoticablue

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof and durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rain poncho after a cheaper plastic one I was using was ripped apart in a crowd at a football game. I haven't worn this poncho yet, but it seems like it will withstand the rain and crowds. It also has a roomy, yet not too roomy, opening for your head. The hood tucks up inside the collar and the sides snap together like a normal rain poncho. Overall, I'm very pleased with the quality of this product.
customer_reviews.author: S. Casaletto

customer_reviews.title: Best rain poncho ever!!
customer_reviews.text: Love the material. Light weight but sturdy. Not cheap plastic that tears. Dries super fast. Easily fits back in pouch for storage. Also love the little clip on handle. I walk the dog, so I have three hooks beside the door. Leash/harness, my coat and this rain poncho. You will not be disappointed. Added plus is the cute Polk a dots style I got.
customer_reviews.author: jeannie1958

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY HUGE
customer_reviews.text: I am a normal sized person and this poncho is enormous, there is no way I would want to wear this. Also, it is heavier than anticipated as an additional item to carry around in my purse "in case it rains" (even if on vacation), and also, I question the thin fabric - not sure how water repellant it would actually be. Going to buy one from a store that I saw that definitely felt waterproof/resistant, and was not so unbelievable huge.
customer_reviews.author: JEO

customer_reviews.title: Good sized adjustable raincoat.
customer_reviews.text: Nice rain coat. Very easy to wear given you can just zip it up instead of having to pull it over your head. Material is thin so , but it's a raincoat so... I'm 5'1" so it comes to my knees which I like. Love having a pocket with a zipper. Really like the weather pattern. Good sized hood too, good adjustment for framing your face to how much you want.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Aaron
